text: 1 serious fail do you fail?
yh i'm doomed
7:47 i don't understand, how would you probably driven to the test center if you have never driven? i'm abit confused

@conquer driving - when they ask you to pull up in a safe place on the left, do they mind how far you go (within reason of course!) or do they expect it to be very soon? i don't want to feel panicked into finding a place and not think it through properly! like when you said you probably could have got away with it but continued a little way - would they have expected you to have stopped there?

good afternoon,
i do have a question, i failed my first driving test due to driving off 35 mph on countryside(it was a really bad weather and not wanted to take any risks).
today, i had my second attempt, same route, however i failed because i was driving off 50 mph on countryside and she had to take verbal actions and asked me to low the speed
i can no longer understand and don't know what speed should i drive in the future, i know it's 60mph but i have the feeling that will always be a failed, unless i'll have the same person next time.
please advise what speed should i drive on countryside?
many thanks.

great video....although just over 10mins in you talk about not getting marked for not checking your left blind spot, when pulling out from the left, and that only your mirror checks and right blind spot is necessary. i got x2 faults for doing exactly that. i was told 2times i didn't do my full 5point check. only 4points.....so maybe it just depends on the examiner, but she 100% marked me for not doing it.

hello! i just started watching your videos, i already have a drivers licence from my country and i have been using the car on the road for some time now. as i drive alone i am not sure if i follow the correct "etiquette" when i am on the road. for example in this video the doves flew when the car was approacing closer to it but sometimes when i am on the road they dont fly off even when im close so i honk at them. if i do this in the exam will it be considered a mistake? will i be asked why i didnt break harder or caused unnecessary noise which could have been distracting to others?
with the emergency stop do not change down gears hit the footbrake then when stoppped dip the clutch to prevent stalling and will stop the car in a shorter distance!!

do you find examiners are incredibly strict? i've been driving for nearly 10 years in america, so i'm quite confident in driving, but i keep hearing stories, even two of yours in the beginning of this video, of failing for what i would think are incredibly minor/pedantic faults. is this worry overblown?

just failed my test today on a stupid mistake, ended up turning right in the left lane as i didnt realise it was a one way and i had to be in the right!! apart from that i only had 3 minors too. i did the parallel parking fine and everything else. just 1 stupid moment when my brain fogged. my worry now is the amount of time i'll have to wait for another test date as my theory runs out in feb really hoping i can get one and pass next time.
i think there's extra pressure to pass first time because of the long wait now

if i see a cat or dog in a road and i'm going to run over it unless i brake harshly i don't care about my driving test at that point imma slam the brakes like aunt bethany slams the margaritas at a wedding
my test is this month nervous
10:15 what??? how does that make any sense? that's something i'd do and it doesn't sound like a mistake at all. actually, is it because it could cause a traffic jam in the long run?
what about small children? should i avoid them or just hit them?
do i need a driving instructor to take the driving test if i can drive and have a foreign license? i have my own car and intend to go alone.

how to deal with idiots on the road? i've joined the dual carriage way from the slip road and the car behind me was tailgating me on the slip road and then joined the dual carriageway at the fist opportunity where the slip road was joining the dual carriageway (and before i did) and was blocking left road and blocking me to join! my car was on the half of the dual carriageway when i had to go back to the slip road because that idiot was blocking me to join. there was a car behind me,i had to slow down to be able to manage to join the carriageway and thankfully didn't run out of the slip road but just about managed to get on it and thankfully a car behind me joined the carriageway on the second lane. that idiot didnt even flinch. why can't they not install automatic mandatory video cameras in each car so one can record and send to the police for dangerous driving assault/harassment.

failed my first test today with two serious fault and 8 minors. the two serious faults been that i went the wrong way when i was doing the independent driving and observation for not checking my right when going through a roundabout (which i am sure i did every time). i was disappointed because i know i did so well.
apparently driving instructors can fail you just because they need to fail a certain amount of people per day. is this true? i have my test in about a week
don't trust passme fast.they have some much excuses not to refund your money-

reading the uk and eu number plates is very hard. why? what is this: aib lo0 c|s?
are the 2nd and 4th the letter i (eye) or the number one?
just failed my test and now i'm miserable

just past my test today! haven't had any lessons (wouldn't recommend) but took my test for the 4th my bad habits i picked up were the reason i kept failing spent all week watching your videos and passed with only 4 minors finally!!!!

bare in mind:
in a petrol car the gear must be changed over 2500 rpms and not under 2000. first gear can be changed within 2000 because ia very short and sharp.
very big risk of engine dying and much more risk of destroying the engine and clutch. good luck

so scared for mine!!!
i got this

that bit bout speeding up and slowing down seems unsafe to me. i hate the parametres for a test. like you said, safe and legal, why does anything else matter? as long as you dont cause another driver to have to stop or swerve to avoid you, and correctly indicate to others and pedestrians when needed, anything else is just a government imposed bit of twattery to make money out the dvsa.
i failed mine today because i took too long to leave a roundabout only because it wa so packed
some humans walk no different to cows and sheep while crossing on busy roads.
as an american is it automatically a dangerous fault if the examiner has to intervene? because here it's an automatic fail if they have to intervene.
so i have my thoery test in february. i am getting 97 percent on the dvsa app. i still feel like i am going to fail. i hate not knowing what the questions are going to be
anyone else finding driving tests extremely hard to come by at the minute?????? passed my theory last week and can't even book a test yet

it seems like britains road rules are much more safe than america. cops here don't even pull people over if they are going 5-10 mph over the limit, and typically will only penalize you if you are going over 10mph above the limit unless there is inclement weather. people will pass on the highway from quickly disappearing merge lanes--they call it a "suicide lane" here because so many people trying to show off will pass other merging cars from that lane even when there's barely any road left for them to do it. people are racing each other at damn near every stoplight and while they mostly will stop racing once they hit the speed limit, many times they won't and they'll race each other until the next light, rev their engines up at each other and all that. i bet there is a lot less accidents in britain because of all the rules you guys have and the much slower speed limits.

i've had my licence for over a year now and i still come to these kind of videos to make sure i still do the correct thing on the road. there's many times where i can see someone do something that i know is the wrong descision, other day i saw an impatient van driver try to overtake a lorry hauling cargo around a small roundabout unaware that the lorry needed the whole round about to pass, the van almost got pinched on the roundabout. i always try to let people through when i can to keep traffic moving on the other side which is something i think a lot of people don't realise sometimes.

with giving way to the pedestrians at junctions.. you will notice that 95% of people on the road don't even know that this is an update to the highway code. in that situation you showed, if you were to stop most and the pedestrian tried to walk, they would have been put in a dangerous situation as the other cars would not have stopped. good information there thank you

i disagree with the information at 10 mins about checking the kerbside blind spot. you shouldn't move off if there is a pedestrian on the pavement close to the car. you won't know this if you fail to check this blind spot. my routine: pedestrians move slower than cars, check the pavement blind spot first, road blind spot second, move without delay, if any delay, restart the process.

the going the wrong way but then not following the lane on the roundabout and trying to continue to go the right way at the danger of crossing the traffic beside me is what i got a serious for in my mock. in sha allah wil be better and not do these pressurised mistakes then in the real thing or in my own life

i'm an adi who qualified this year and your discussion of the rule changes that came in regarding giving way to more vulnerable road users just shows how difficult it is for the average driver (let alone learners) to apply correctly. i wonder how long it will be before that rule is discreetly removed (even though i think it is good in its intentions) and also how many examiners have failed pupils because they haven't followed the rule correctly. i haven't had a single student pick up a single fault because of this change in the rules so far.

9:15 that's kind of why i failed my first test, 2/3 of the way through the test we entered a station car park and i parked forward into a bay perfectly between two cars, then when i left the bay, i didn't put the manual handbrake down fully, it was up by one notch. it had been that long since i'd made such a basic error that i couldn't work out what the noise was until the examiner told me so failed
will i get a serious if my parking at side of road is constantly not good

you talking about the show me tell me questions reminded me on how i'm my test they asked me to open the window and i accidentally pulled on the e brake and the car started slowing down. thought i failed but ended up with a pass at the end hahahahaha.

got my driving test tomorrow, did a mock today and got 1 serious off a stupid mistake i never make (it was dark and raining i couldn't see the road)
here's to tomorrow!
i am learning automatic, no clutch control, no hill start problem, no coasting, no car coming back at up the hill stop , i have test on 12th of december.
